title: Reuters safety adviser killed, journalists injured in hotel strike in Ukraine
content: Ryan Evans, a former British soldier providing security services to Reuters journalists, was killed when a hotel in Ukraine was hit by a missile.
summary: Ryan Evans, a former British soldier providing security services to Reuters journalists, was killed when a hotel in Ukraine was hit by a missile.

title: Telegram founder Pavel Durov detained in France
content: Pavel Durov’s online messaging app Telegram has come under increasing scrutiny from governments concerned about its unmoderated messaging services.
summary: Pavel Durov’s online messaging app Telegram has come under increasing scrutiny from governments concerned about its unmoderated messaging services.

title: German feds take over festival stabbing case, citing suspected terrorism
content: A 26-year-old Syrian man turned himself in after a deadly attack at a festival. Officials are investigating him on suspicion of being an Islamic State member.
summary: A 26-year-old Syrian man turned himself in after a deadly attack at a festival. Officials are investigating him on suspicion of being an Islamic State member.

title: Israel, Hezbollah exchange heaviest strikes in months, raising regional tension
content: The dramatic but contained escalation overnight Sunday stopped short of all-out war, with Hezbollah and Israel both signaling restraint.
summary: The dramatic but contained escalation overnight Sunday stopped short of all-out war, with Hezbollah and Israel both signaling restraint.

title: Hezbollah ends operation after successful drone and rocket strike, leader says
Hezbollah’s escalated attack ‘is over’ after trading airstrikes with Israel, leader says
content: Israel said it preemptively struck Hezbollah targets to foil an attack from the group. The escalation in Israel and Lebanon comes ahead of Gaza cease-fire talks in Cairo.
summary: Israel said it preemptively struck Hezbollah targets to foil an attack from the group. The escalation in Israel and Lebanon comes ahead of Gaza cease-fire talks in Cairo.

Ukraine has captured more than 200 Russian soldiers in Kursk offensive, videos show
content: Visuals verified by The Post show more than 240 Russian prisoners, which analysts say appear to include conscripts with minimal fighting experience.

title: Ilya Yashin, the activist who didn’t want to leave Russian prison
content: Ilya Yashin wanted to resist Putin’s regime from inside the country, but after the prisoner swap, he must learn to be part of Russia’s opposition in exile.
summary: Ilya Yashin wanted to resist Putin’s regime from inside the country, but after the prisoner swap, he must learn to be part of Russia’s opposition in exile.

French police arrest suspect in arson attack on synagogue
content: Authorities had opened a terrorism investigation into the attack on a synagogue in La Grande-Motte in southern France.

title: German authorities say suspect in deadly knife attack now in custody
content: The attack took place Friday in Solingen in western Germany, where residents had gathered for a festival. Officials said they had not ruled out terrorism.
summary: The attack took place Friday in Solingen in western Germany, where residents had gathered for a festival. Officials said they had not ruled out terrorism.

title: Hamas delegates in Cairo as Gaza cease-fire talks resume
content: The Hamas delegation is not expected to participate directly in the talks, but it will be briefed on the negotiations by Egypt and Qatar, officials said.
summary: The Hamas delegation is not expected to participate directly in the talks, but it will be briefed on the negotiations by Egypt and Qatar, officials said.

title: Italy opens manslaughter investigation into Sicily yacht sinking
content: Italian prosecutors say no suspect has been idenitifed in the investigation into the deaths of seven people after Monday’s sinking of the Bayesian.
summary: Italian prosecutors say no suspect has been idenitifed in the investigation into the deaths of seven people after Monday’s sinking of the Bayesian.

title: Ukraine keeps crossing Russia’s red lines. Putin keeps blinking.
content: Ukraine’s punch through Russian defenses in the first foreign invasion since World War II has laid bare Moscow’s apparently illusory red lines.
summary: Ukraine’s punch through Russian defenses in the first foreign invasion since World War II has laid bare Moscow’s apparently illusory red lines.

title: Europe’s most dangerous volcano rumbles, and Italians weigh the risk
content: As the Phlegraean Fields volcano awakens, scientists debate the peril posed by a monster thought to have caused the most violent eruption of pre-historic Europe.
summary: As the Phlegraean Fields volcano awakens, scientists debate the peril posed by a monster thought to have caused the most violent eruption of pre-historic Europe.

title: Australia offers U.S. a vast new military launchpad in China conflict
content: Australia is expanding its northern military bases, with U.S. support, to counter China's growing threat. Critics quip it’s become the “51st state.”
summary: Australia is expanding its northern military bases, with U.S. support, to counter China's growing threat. Critics quip it’s become the “51st state.”

title: South Koreans once chipped in for fighter jets. Now, they make their own.
content: The U.S. Phantom F-4 fighter jet, which South Korea has just retired from use, acts as a metaphor for the countries’ security alliance. It’s also a hell of a ride.
summary: The U.S. Phantom F-4 fighter jet, which South Korea has just retired from use, acts as a metaphor for the countries’ security alliance. It’s also a hell of a ride.
